> Is there a simple way to test that a class follows the bean conventions?
> 
> Does someone perhaps have a method like this?
> 	assertBean("Should be a java bean", MyClass.class());
> 
> If not. How could I make it?

I think BeanLint can help you.

* BeanLint: A JavaBeans troubleshooting tool
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-1998/jw-12-beans_p.html (Part1)
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-01-1999/jw-01-beans_p.html (Part2)

Hiro
